member.summary: HyperLiquid account endpoints. Account endpoints include balance info, withdraw/deposit info and requesting and account settings

member.param: Address to request balances for. If not provided will use the address provided in the API credentials

member.param: Address to request rate limits for. If not provided will use the address provided in the API credentials

member.param: Address to request approved builder fee for. If not provided will use the address provided in the API credentials

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.Api.IHyperLiquidRestClientApiAccount.TransferUsdAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send usd to another address. This transfer does not touch the EVM bridge.
member.param: The id of the chain used when signing in hexadecimal format; e.g. "0xa4b1" for Arbitrum

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.Api.IHyperLiquidRestClientApiAccount.TransferSpotAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send spot assets to another address. This transfer does not touch the EVM bridge.
member.param: The id of the chain used when signing in hexadecimal format; e.g. "0xa4b1" for Arbitrum

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.Api.IHyperLiquidRestClientApiAccount.WithdrawAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiate the withdrawal flow. After making this request, the L1 validators will sign and send the withdrawal request to the bridge contract. There is a $1 fee for withdrawing at the time of this writing and withdrawals take approximately 5 minutes to finalize.
member.param: The id of the chain used when signing in hexadecimal format; e.g. "0xa4b1" for Arbitrum

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.Api.IHyperLiquidRestClientApiAccount.TransferInternalAsync(System.String,HyperLiquid.Net.Enums.TransferDirection,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Transfer USD between Spot and Futures account
member.param: The id of the chain used when signing in hexadecimal format; e.g. "0xa4b1" for Arbitrum

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.Api.IHyperLiquidRestClientApiTrading.CancelAfterAsync(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Cancel all orders after the provided timeout has passed. Can be called at an interval to act as deadman switch. Pass null to cancel an existing timeout. This functionality is only available after achieving a certain trading volume.
member.param: Timeout after which to cancel all order, or null to cancel the countdown
Edit order by order id, either this or clientOrderId should be provided
Edit order by client order id, either this or orderId should be provided
The new client order id, an optional 128 bit hex string, e.g. 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef

member.summary: The top amount of results to keep in sync. If for example limit=10 is used, the order book will contain the 10 best bids and 10 best asks. Leaving this null will sync the full order book

member.param: Service provider for resolving logging and clients

member.name: T:HyperLiquid.Net.SymbolOrderBooks.HyperLiquidSymbolOrderBook
member.summary: Implementation for a synchronized order book. After calling Start the order book will sync itself and keep up to date with new data. It will automatically try to reconnect and resync in case of a lost/interrupted connection. Make sure to check the State property to see if the order book is synced.
